intro: Glinus cambessedesii var. nudiusculus, commonly known as the naked-stemmed glinus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairless stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
